0: 授業概要・カリキュラム上の位置づけ
1: This course builds on Craig Sisman’ s first semester moving image course: it is designed to help Art students become even more creative when using English. The teacher,Craig Sisman,is a native speaker of British English with a background in language education and moving image production. Craig will help students work in groups to produce their own moving image projects. During the course,students will explore(through practical experimentation)the following twelve elements of cinematic art:（1） time; （2） light; （3） form; （4） image; （6） space; （7） movement; （8） language （written and spoken）; （9） performance; （10） narrative; （11） sound; （12） music. Students will explore each element from various points-of-view, including naturalism, formalism and abstraction.

0: 準備学習内容・時間の目安
1: In addition to completing homework,students should prepare to be active and take advantage of the learning opportunities available（30 minutes).

Students’ grades will be based on: （1） attendance; （2） attitude to learning; （3） general participation in class; （4） individual contribution to group work; （5） class work; （6） each group’ s final movie project. The final projects will be assessed on: （a） creative use of the English language, (b) creative use of cinematic language.
